title: Justification - Definition of Derivative at Point

content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is not differentiable at <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></math>. Which of the following statements must be true?

choices.label: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is not continuous at <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 5, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> does not exist.

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 5, of, the fraction with numerator, f of x minus f of 5, and denominator, x minus 5, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></munder><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> does not exist.

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 5, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> does not exist.

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 5, of, the fraction with numerator, f of x minus f of 5, and denominator, x minus 5, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></munder><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> does not exist.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test to apply.
